perturbation.original_text:
The Master Franchise Agreement requires non-binding mediation. The mediation will occur in New York with the costs being borne
by equally by the parties. Prospective franchisees are encouraged to consult private legal counsel to determine the applicability of
California and federal laws (such as Business and Professions Code Section 20040.5 and Code of Civil Procedure Section 1281) to any
provisions of a franchise agreement restricting venue to a forum outside the State of California.
perturbation.changed_text:
The Master Franchise Agreement requires non-binding mediation. Prospective franchisees are encouraged to consult private legal counsel to determine the applicability of
California and federal laws (such as Business and Professions Code Section 20040.5 and Code of Civil Procedure Section 1281) to any
provisions of a franchise agreement restricting venue to a forum outside the State of California.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the clause 'The mediation will occur in New York with the costs being borne by equally by the parties,' the enforceability of the mediation clause becomes uncertain. Other sections might still refer to mandatory mediation, creating a contradiction if the location and cost-sharing are undefined or changed elsewhere.

perturbation.original_text:
You must sign a general release if you renew or transfer your franchise. California Corporation Code 31512 voids a waiver of your
rights under the Franchise Investment Law (California Corporations Code 31000 through 31516). Business and Professions Code
20010 voids a waiver of your rights under the Franchise Relations Act (Business and Professions Code 20000 through 20043).
perturbation.changed_text: You must sign a general release if you renew or transfer your franchise.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the information about California laws that void waivers of rights creates a potential contradiction. If other sections of the agreement still require franchisees to waive certain rights, this omission creates an inconsistency because the enforceability of the waivers under California law is no longer explicitly addressed here, potentially leading to disputes.

perturbation.original_text:
The Master Franchise Agreement contains a liquidated damages clause. Under California Civil Code Section 1671, certain liquidated
damages clauses are unenforceable.
perturbation.changed_text: The Master Franchise Agreement contains a liquidated damages clause.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the sentence relating to California Civil Code Section 1671, it creates a possible in-text contradiction. Without the caveat regarding the unenforceability of certain liquidated damages clauses under California law, the franchisor might attempt to enforce clauses that are, in fact, legally invalid within California. If other parts of the contract rely on the unrestricted application of the liquidated damages clause, this omission will cause inconsistencies.
